DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Other Characteristic Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to describe indicators, clinical manifestations, or complications related to cGVHD (chronic Graft vs. Host Disease) that are not otherwise identified.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The assessment of the transplant recipient for signs and symptoms of chronic Graft versus Host Disease (GVHD).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease or condition that persists or progresses over a long period of time.:Graft-versus-host disease. A reaction of donated bone marrow or peripheral stem cells against a person's tissue.

Concepts.definition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.
Graft-versus-host disease. A reaction of donated bone marrow or peripheral stem cells against a person's tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Other Characteristic Text
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text to describe indicators, clinical manifestations, or complications related to cGVHD (chronic Graft vs. Host Disease) not otherwise identified.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Other Characteristics Text
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases.  Onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:Not otherwise specified.:Characteristics; distinguishing qualities of a person, object, or substance.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support NIH cGVHD Scoring Sheet addition to C3D by CCR.
